content:
• Thursday, January 19, 2012
  • ARCC

    Ares Capital (NASDAQ:ARCC) drops 3.5% AH after announcing a 14.28M share stock offering, good...

    Ares Capital (NASDAQ:ARCC) drops 3.5% AH after announcing a 14.28M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $228M based on today's close. Ares plans to use the proceeds to reduce its debt load, and possibly to make new investments.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:42 PM
  • ALNY

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALNY) announces a restructuring plan that will include a 33%...

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALNY) announces a restructuring plan that will include a 33% reduction in the size of its workforce, with the goal of focusing on drugs aimed at treating amyloidosis and hemophilia. Analysts estimate Alnylam's 2011 revenue fell 17%, and expect its 2012 revenue to decline another 26.3%. Shares are currently halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM
  • MPC

    Activist investor Jana Partners discloses a 5.5% stake in Marathon Petroleum (NYSE:MPC),...

    Activist investor Jana Partners discloses a 5.5% stake in Marathon Petroleum (NYSE:MPC), according to an SEC filing, apparently making Barry Rosenstein's hedge fund MPC's largest shareholder. Jana has built a track record of pressing companies - MHP, EP - to break up, but it's not yet clear what it wants this time. MPC +3.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • NCIT

    NCI (NASDAQ:NCIT), a provider of government IT services, falls 21.5% AH after establishing a...

    NCI (NASDAQ:NCIT), a provider of government IT services, falls 21.5% AH after establishing a 2012 revenue guidance range of $340M-$360M - far below a $514.8M consensus, and even further below a 2011 revenue consensus of $560.2M. The shortfall is attributed to a variety of contract losses, reductions, and expirations.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM
  • CLGX

    CoreLogic (NYSE:CLGX) jumps 10.3% AH after stating it expects to beat its 2011 guidance, thanks...

    CoreLogic (NYSE:CLGX) jumps 10.3% AH after stating it expects to beat its 2011 guidance, thanks to growth in mortgage origination volumes and the execution of a cost reduction plan. The company is also guiding for 2012 revenue of $1.425B-$1.475B and EPS of $0.95-$1.05; the former is just in-line with a $1.44B consensus, but the latter is soundly above a Street forecast of $0.87.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • SWKS

    More on Skyworks' (NASDAQ:SWKS) FQ1: The company expects FQ2 revenue of $360M and EPS of $0.40;...

    More on Skyworks' (NASDAQ:SWKS) FQ1: The company expects FQ2 revenue of $360M and EPS of $0.40; the latter is in-line, but the former is above a $348.9M. Skyworks adds it expects its recently-closed acquisition of Advanced Analogic to be accretive to its FY12 results, albeit neutral to FQ2. The results are one more example of a strong performance (I, II) from an iPhone supplier. SWKS +5.8% AH. TQNT +1.7%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • GOOG

    During its earnings call, Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) attributes the decline in its cost-per-click,...

    During its earnings call, Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) attributes the decline in its cost-per-click, partly responsible for its Q4 miss, to forex issues and unnamed changes it's made to increase its paid clicks. The company also says its display ad business is now on a $5B run rate (up from $2.5B in Oct. '10), and that 250M Android devices have been activated (up from 200M in November). GOOG -8.7% AH. (webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM | 14 Comments
  • ISRG

    More on Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q4 EPS and revenue beat estimates, but most of the...

    More on Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q4 EPS and revenue beat estimates, but most of the upside was due to a lower tax rate. Sequential revenue and procedure growth actually declined. Shares -3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q4 EPS of $3.75 beats by $0.40. Revenue of $497M (+28% Y/Y)...

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q4 EPS of $3.75 beats by $0.40. Revenue of $497M (+28% Y/Y) beats by $14M. Shares -4.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • SWKS

    Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ:SWKS): FQ1 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $393.7M (+17% Y/Y)...

    Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ:SWKS): FQ1 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $393.7M (+17% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • COF

    More on Capital One (NYSE:COF): Q4 loan balances up 4.6% Q/Q, 7.9% Y/Y. Net interest margin...

    More on Capital One (NYSE:COF): Q4 loan balances up 4.6% Q/Q, 7.9% Y/Y. Net interest margin declined 17 bps to 7.22%. The charge-off rate increased 17 bps to 2.69%. Provision for loan losses increased $239M Q/Q, $518M Y/Y. Marketing expense up $91M Y/Y. Shares -5.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • MSFT

    More on Microsoft: Results hurt by 6% Y/Y decline in Windows revenue (2% increase in FQ1)....

    More on Microsoft: Results hurt by 6% Y/Y decline in Windows revenue (2% increase in FQ1). However, Server & Tools revenue rose 11%  (10% in FQ1), and Office division revenue rose 3% (8% in FQ1). Entertainment Division revenue (Xbox) rose 15% Y/Y, and the Online Services division's loss narrowed to $458M. Company now expects FY12 operating expenses of $28.5B-$28.9B (prior guidance of $28.6B-$29.2B). MSFT +2.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • FLEX

    More on Flextronics (NASDAQ:FLEX): FQ3 revenues hit in-line, but EPS misses on a 35% Y/Y drop in...

    More on Flextronics (NASDAQ:FLEX): FQ3 revenues hit in-line, but EPS misses on a 35% Y/Y drop in operating income due to one-time charges related to its exiting the ODM PC business. Additionally, the company guides FQ4 revenue below estimates, now expecting to earn between $6.3B - $6.8B. Street estimates are for $6.8B. Shares -3.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • COF

    Capital One (NYSE:COF): Q4 EPS of $0.88 misses by $0.69. Revenue of $4.05B (-2% Y/Y) in-line....

    Capital One (NYSE:COF): Q4 EPS of $0.88 misses by $0.69. Revenue of $4.05B (-2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • IBM

    More on IBM:  Company expects 2012 EPS of $14.85, slightly above $14.82 consensus. Americas...

    More on IBM:  Company expects 2012 EPS of $14.85, slightly above $14.82 consensus. Americas revenue +2% Y/Y, EMEA +1%, Asia-Pac +2% - all growth rates down notably from Q3 levels. Services revenue +3% Y/Y, backlog stood at $141B - up $4B Q/Q, but down $2B Y/Y. Software revenue +9% Y/Y. But hardware revenue fell 8%, thanks to a 31% drop in mainframe revenue. Free cash flow was $9B, up $300M Y/Y. IBM +3.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • FLEX

    Flextronics International (NASDAQ:FLEX): FQ3 EPS of $0.18 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $7.5B (-4%...

    Flextronics International (NASDAQ:FLEX): FQ3 EPS of $0.18 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $7.5B (-4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • GOOG

    More on Google: International revenue fell to 53% of total from 55% in Q3, a decline that...

    More on Google: International revenue fell to 53% of total from 55% in Q3, a decline that suggests European weakness played a large role in the shortfall. Paid clicks +34% Y/Y (+28% in Q3), but cost-per-click fell 8% Q/Q and Y/Y. 69% of revenue from Google sites, steady with Q3. Free cash flow was $2.97B, slightly below net income of $3.13B, thanks to capex of $951M (12% of revenue). GOOG -9.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • INTC

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC): Q4 adjusted EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $13.9B (+22% Y/Y) beats...

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC): Q4 adjusted EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $13.9B (+22% Y/Y) beats by $0.2B. Shares +2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 4 Comments
  • SQNM

    Shares of Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM) fall 7.8% AH after the firm announces that it plans to sell...

    Shares of Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM) fall 7.8% AH after the firm announces that it plans to sell shares in an underwritten public offering without specifying an amount or a time period.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • GOOG

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Q4 EPS of $9.50 misses by $0.95. Revenue of $8.13B (25+% Y/Y) misses by...

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Q4 EPS of $9.50 misses by $0.95. Revenue of $8.13B (25+% Y/Y) misses by $0.3B. Shares -9.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • TPX

    Sealy's (ZZ -17.9%) nightmare Q4, in which the mattress maker showed weaker sales and margins,...

    Sealy's (ZZ -17.9%) nightmare Q4, in which the mattress maker showed weaker sales and margins, prompts a stock downgrade and EPS reduction from Raymond James: "We simply can no longer justify a more optimistic rating given Sealy's deteriorating financial results, highly dilutive capital structure and the strategic uncertainties created by the pending CEO transition."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 4 Comments
  • MDT

    Covidien (COV +3.8%) expands a recall of sensors used to monitor patients under anesthesia...

    Covidien (COV +3.8%) expands a recall of sensors used to monitor patients under anesthesia because of a modification that could result in inaccurate data, following a separate voluntary recall announced earlier this week. A J.P. Morgan analyst says COV's core medical devices business looks healthy despite broader challenges facing the industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (BSX +2.6%) moves up on a Bernstein upgrade to Outperform, saying it expects a...

    Boston Scientific (BSX +2.6%) moves up on a Bernstein upgrade to Outperform, saying it expects a rebound in the ICD market to boost its multiple.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • SJT

    Natural gas tumbles to nine-year lows following the 87B cubic feet draw announced today by the...

    Natural gas tumbles to nine-year lows following the 87B cubic feet draw announced today by the EIA. But unhedged natural gas trusts haven't fully priced in the glut of natural gas, which could translate into more downside for companies like San Juan Basin Royalty Trust (SJT -3.6%), Hugoton Royalty Trust (HGT-OLD -1.8%) and Sabine Royalty Trust (SBR +0.2%). (submitted by Todd Johnson)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • GRMN

    Garmin (GRMN +2.8%) trades higher after Canaccord raises its rating to Buy, saying its PND...

    Garmin (GRMN +2.8%) trades higher after Canaccord raises its rating to Buy, saying its PND segment will stabilize in a few quarters and that its OEM business is gaining traction.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • NTAP

    Storage vendor NetApp (NTAP +7.1%) moves up on an earlier report that speculates the company may...

    Storage vendor NetApp (NTAP +7.1%) moves up on an earlier report that speculates the company may see some takeover interest from larger technology firms in 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • STL

    Provident New York Bancorp (PBNY +3.8%) moves higher after Sterne Agee upped the shares to...

    Provident New York Bancorp (PBNY +3.8%) moves higher after Sterne Agee upped the shares to Neutral earlier today, citing its Gotham Bank acquisition and better clarity on its growth plans.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • LXRX

    Shares of Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX -10.7%) fall sharply on heavy volume on news that the...

    Shares of Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX -10.7%) fall sharply on heavy volume on news that the FDA rejected an experimental diabetes treatment being developed by Bristol-Myers Squibb and AstraZeneca. The abrupt falloff in share price comes even though medical officers with the company maintain that their drug is in a distinct class from dapagliflozin.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • BAC

    Better-than-expected results from BofA (BAC +3.3%) and Morgan Stanley (MS +5.9%) extend bank...

    Better-than-expected results from BofA (BAC +3.3%) and Morgan Stanley (MS +5.9%) extend bank stocks' (XLF +1.1%) impressive January run, but they're clearing a significantly lowered bar. In July, the consensus saw Q4 financial sector EPS growth of 36.6%, by early October it was 26.6%, on Jan. 3 it was 10.1%, and as of yesterday it stood at 2.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com (CRM +5.8%) is up sharply thanks to a bullish note from Morgan Stanley's Adam...

    Salesforce.com (CRM +5.8%) is up sharply thanks to a bullish note from Morgan Stanley's Adam Holt. Holt left a conversation with CFO Graham Smith believing Salesforce continues to add sales users at a brisk pace, and that the company's billings growth, a major area of concern (I, II) in recent months, is gaining steam.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • BRS

    Bristow Group (BRS +3.8%) gains after Dahlman Rose initiates the shares with a Buy, saying the...

    Bristow Group (BRS +3.8%) gains after Dahlman Rose initiates the shares with a Buy, saying the company should be able to take advantage of the improving offshore and deepwater spending cycle with its revamped fleet of helicopters.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • CRVL

    Shares of CorVel (CRVL -8.1%) sink after Copperfield Research posts a negative report on SA that...

    Shares of CorVel (CRVL -8.1%) sink after Copperfield Research posts a negative report on SA that raises red flags on potential Medicare fraud at the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • UNH

    In spite of beating Q4 estimates, UnitedHealth (UNH -4.1%) is selling off today thanks to its...

    In spite of beating Q4 estimates, UnitedHealth (UNH -4.1%) is selling off today thanks to its soft guidance: the health insurance giant expects 2012 revenue of $107B-$108B and EPS of $4.55-$4.75, largely below a consensus of $108B and $4.77. In addition, the company made some cautious earnings call comments about membership growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • GURE

    Gulf Resources (GURE +9.9%) pops after saying it's discovered underground brine water resources...

    Gulf Resources (GURE +9.9%) pops after saying it's discovered underground brine water resources in Daying County, Sichuan Province, after more than a half year of drilling. Brine is used for bromine and crude salt extraction, and the discovered resource is six to seven times higher in bromine concentration than its industry average.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • GPS

    Shares of Gap (GPS +3.6%) rally off of a report from Women's Wear Daily that fashion exec Tracy...

    Shares of Gap (GPS +3.6%) rally off of a report from Women's Wear Daily that fashion exec Tracy Garnder is returning to the company to help turn around the retailer's lackluster women's division.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • FSLR

    Solar stocks are getting whacked as the German environment minister may get his way in a push...

    Solar stocks are getting whacked as the German environment minister may get his way in a push for subsidy cuts with a goal of limiting new installed capacity to 3.5K -5K MW/year. Solar ETF: KWT -5.7%. FSLR -9.6%, JASO -16.6%, JKS -7.9%, TSL -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • LUV

    Southwest Airlines (LUV +3.2%) CEO Gary Kelly says it may delay its expansion out to as late as...

    Southwest Airlines (LUV +3.2%) CEO Gary Kelly says it may delay its expansion out to as late as 2014 as $100-a-barrel oil erodes profit growth,

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • XLNX

    Another day, another rally for chip stocks (SOXX +1.8%). Xilinx's (XLNX +1%) results and...

    Another day, another rally for chip stocks (SOXX +1.8%). Xilinx's (XLNX +1%) results and guidance are the triggers this time around, even if the company itself is seeing some investors take profits following yesterday's jump. During its earnings call, Xilinx claimed sales to the enterprise networking market were strong last quarter, and said it expects sales to telecom and industrial customers to rise this quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • NTCT

    Shares of NetScout Systems (NTCT +16.4%) soar after the firm reports better-than-expected FQ3...

    Shares of NetScout Systems (NTCT +16.4%) soar after the firm reports better-than-expected FQ3 earnings and brings in 2012 earnings guidance that sits above the consensus estimate of analysts. The company also says it's entering FQ4 with an order backlog of $13M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • PGR

    Progressive (PGR +3.5%) moves up after its Q4 beat estimates. An 8% jump in net premiums helped...

    Progressive (PGR +3.5%) moves up after its Q4 beat estimates. An 8% jump in net premiums helped to offset a 14% Y/Y decline in earnings, which were negatively impacted by a hefty decline in investment gains and increased competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • AMFW

    Energy infrastructure contractor Foster Wheeler (FWLT +6%) spikes higher after announcing it won...

    Energy infrastructure contractor Foster Wheeler (FWLT +6%) spikes higher after announcing it won a contract to build an LNG receiving terminal for state-owned Indian Oil. Foster Wheeler says the company's value will be included in its Q4 bookings.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • VHC

    Though off its highs for the day, VirnetX (VHC +1.9%) is still outperforming after being granted...

    Though off its highs for the day, VirnetX (VHC +1.9%) is still outperforming after being granted a motion in a lawsuit filed against Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO), and others over a patent related to VPN technology. Shares soared last month after the USPTO denied an Apple request to have a VirnetX patent reexamined.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • OAS

    Oasis Petroleum (OAS -3.6%) takes a hit after UBS cut the shares to Neutral on valuation. The...

    Oasis Petroleum (OAS -3.6%) takes a hit after UBS cut the shares to Neutral on valuation. The firm says the stock has already appreciated 22% YTD, and it's likely the company will issue weak 2012 guidance next week and miss on its Q4 earnings report.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • NFLX

    Contributing to Netflix's (NFLX +4.9%) rally may be an NPD report claiming the company's Q4...

    Contributing to Netflix's (NFLX +4.9%) rally may be an NPD report claiming the company's Q4 share of the disc rental market was 25%, and its share of the paid digital movie rental market was 55%. While down from Q3 levels, the figures might be soothing fears of massive Q4 share losses. NPD also claims Coinstar's (CSTR +1.7%) share of the disc rental market rose 1200 bps in 2011, to 37%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM

  • The slide in natural gas is relentless, off another 5.3% today as the latest supply report shows...

    The slide in natural gas is relentless, off another 5.3% today as the latest supply report shows inventory levels 20.8% above the 5-year average. Supportive of prices over the longer term, producers are lining up for government permission to begin exporting gas.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • ESI-OLD

    Shares of ITT Educational Services (ESI-OLD +5.5%) spiked as high as 11% up before settling back...

    Shares of ITT Educational Services (ESI-OLD +5.5%) spiked as high as 11% up before settling back as investors go back and forth on whether or not the Obama administration will change a student financial aid program called the 90/10 rule. Shares of CECO +8.6%, APOL +2.6%, and DV +1.7% are also seeing high trading volume and volatility on the same buzz.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • ON

    ON Semiconductor (ONNN +2.98%) gains after UBS ups the shares to Buy, citing expectations for a...

    ON Semiconductor (ONNN +2.98%) gains after UBS ups the shares to Buy, citing expectations for a boost in revenue and margin in 2012 driven by the company's acquisition of Sanyo Semiconductor.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • UNP

    Union Pacific (UNP +3.7%) trades up after its Q4 earnings beat across the board. Profit jumped a...

    Union Pacific (UNP +3.7%) trades up after its Q4 earnings beat across the board. Profit jumped a greater-than-expected 24% Y/Y, as freight revenue grew across all lines, offsetting the impact of higher fuel costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • NFLX

    Class-action suits or not, Netflix (NFLX +5.7%) continues to rally ahead of next Wednesday's Q4...

    Class-action suits or not, Netflix (NFLX +5.7%) continues to rally ahead of next Wednesday's Q4 report, thanks to optimism about stabilizing subscriber levels and the company's U.K./Ireland launch. Shares are now up 50% YTD, and up 67% from their Nov. 30 low. 18.4% of Netflix's float was shorted as of Dec. 30; it's quite likely that figure is now lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 2 Comments
  • TEX

    Terex (TEX +4.7%) moves up after Baird raises its rating to Outperform, noting the company has...

    Terex (TEX +4.7%) moves up after Baird raises its rating to Outperform, noting the company has better earnings power and a lower sales multiple than its peers. Conversely, the firm cuts Astec Industries (ASTE +0.8%) to Neutral on valuation, saying the stock is within 10% of its $38 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • RSH

    Moody's downgrades Radio Shack (RSH -3.1%) to Ba2 from Ba1 and keeps a negative outlook in...

    Moody's downgrades Radio Shack (RSH -3.1%) to Ba2 from Ba1 and keeps a negative outlook in place. "We do not expect the negative trend in margins and credit metrics for RadioShack to reverse in the near to medium term."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • VNR

    Shares of Vanguard Natural Resources (VNR -4.2%) prices its 7.1M common unit offering at $27.71,...

    Shares of Vanguard Natural Resources (VNR -4.2%) prices its 7.1M common unit offering at $27.71, a 4% discount to Wednesday's closing price. A unit of Denbury Resources (DNR +1.3%), the company's largest holder, was the biggest seller, selling roughly 3.1M units.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • EBAY

    eBay (EBAY +4.1%) CEO John Donahoe gives a peek under the hood at some of the firm's online...

    eBay (EBAY +4.1%) CEO John Donahoe gives a peek under the hood at some of the firm's online metrics for the holiday season during an earnings CC. He says the tech concern recorded up to 10K transactions per minute on Cyber Monday and hit its biggest mobile payday ever with consumers spending $180 per second through eBay apps over the holiday season.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 2 Comments
  • DHI

    What was that about a housing recovery? Homebuilder stocks fall as housing starts fell 4.1% last...

    What was that about a housing recovery? Homebuilder stocks fall as housing starts fell 4.1% last month, after yesterday's report that sentiment among builders had risen to its highest level since 2007. Ratings of several homebuilders - including DHI -1.7%, LEN -0.9% and TOL -2.1% - were cut to Neutral from Buy, while KBH -1.1% and MTH -3.3% were slashed to Sell by UBS.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • KODK

    Shares in Kodak (EK),which filed for bankruptcy today, were suspended after they fell 35.1%...

    Shares in Kodak (EK),which filed for bankruptcy today, were suspended after they fell 35.1% following the opening bell.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • BMY

    The FDA rejects an experimental diabetes drug co-developed by Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY -2.8%)...

    The FDA rejects an experimental diabetes drug co-developed by Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY -2.8%) and AstraZeneca (AZN -2.2%), asking for more clinical data to assess its safety and efficacy. Analysts said the drug could have generated ~$400M in global sales by 2016, but an FDA advisory panel had previously recommended against it, citing safety concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • GLNG

    Golar LNG (GLNG +4.9%) moves higher after Dahlman Rose ups the shares to Buy on valuation,...

    Golar LNG (GLNG +4.9%) moves higher after Dahlman Rose ups the shares to Buy on valuation, saying the company has landed some lucrative contracts and is in a strong position operationally to take advantage of positive LNG market fundamentals.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • CCL

    Carnival (CCL +2.8%) rebounds a little more (previously) after losing nearly a fifth of its...

    Carnival (CCL +2.8%) rebounds a little more (previously) after losing nearly a fifth of its value on account of the Concordia disaster. Nomura's Harry Curtis comes to Carnival's defense today, noting the cruise line operator is insured against human error (the apparent cause of the crash), and arguing the $3.5B decline seen in Carnival's market cap amounts to an overreaction.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • BHGE

    Oil services stocks show earlier strength - outpacing shares of producers in advance of a report...

    Oil services stocks show earlier strength - outpacing shares of producers in advance of a report on petroleum inventories set for later this morning. Advancers: BHI +2.2%, SLB +3.1%, HAL +3.7%, RIG +2.5%, WFT +2.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks (FFIV +10.9%) is off to the races after strong sales of its Viprion 2400 mid-range...

    F5 Networks (FFIV +10.9%) is off to the races after strong sales of its Viprion 2400 mid-range switch helped it beat FQ1 estimates and deliver solid FQ2 guidance. Also helping is an upgrade to Buy from BofA, which is impressed with F5's performance in the face of macro and seasonal weakness. Rising in sympathy: RVBD +4.4%. ARUN +6.7%. JNPR +3.5%. RDWR +2.2%. PKT +2.4%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • EBAY

    Nomura is reiterating a Neutral on eBay (EBAY +3.1%) following yesterday's Q4 beat (I, II)....

    Nomura is reiterating a Neutral on eBay (EBAY +3.1%) following yesterday's Q4 beat (I, II). While recognizing the margin strength shown by eBay's Marketplaces business, the firm also notes its North American gross merchandise volume only rose 10% Y/Y, well below Nomura's 18% forecast. This reinforces Nomura's skepticism regarding the sustainability of Marketplaces' turnaround. (transcript).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 1 Comment
